Foc i Oli is a super tiny place.  There are ten seats.  Ten.  You will sit at a counter.  There is no privacy.That's normally the kind of place I'd hate, but Foc i Oli makes some incredible burgers.I had the Chivito (thin slices of beef steak, ham, bacon, mayo, salad dressing, gouda, red pepper and caramelized onion on brioche bread.)  For 9.80 €, it was a taste sensation.  I loved it.  Although not technically a burger, it basically tasted like one.We arrived near closing time, but the guys here were super-accommodating.  Most locals seemed to grab their burgers to go.They do serve beer (I believe they have just one tap) and have some spirits on the wall, so I guess they can whip up a few mixed drinks.Whether you get a burger to go or squeeze your way into a seat, Foc i Oli is an awesome addition to your Barcelona checklist.
